articles.title: Breastfeeding Basics: Getting Started
articles.description: A comprehensive guide to establishing successful breastfeeding
articles.content:
# Breastfeeding Basics

Breastfeeding is a natural way to nourish your baby, but it doesn't always come naturally. This guide will help you get started with confidence.

## Benefits of Breastfeeding

- Provides ideal nutrition for babies
- Boosts baby's immune system
- Promotes bonding between mother and baby
- Reduces risk of certain illnesses for both mother and baby

## Getting Started

### The First Feed
Try to breastfeed within the first hour after birth when your baby is alert and ready to feed...

### Finding the Right Position
There are several positions you can try:
- Cradle hold
- Cross-cradle hold
- Football hold
- Side-lying position

### Signs of a Good Latch
- Baby's mouth is wide open
- Lips are flanged outward
- You can see more areola above the baby's mouth than below
- No clicking sounds while feeding
- No pain after the initial latch

## Common Challenges and Solutions

scripts.title: When Baby Won't Feed
scripts.scenario: Your baby is crying and refusing to feed

steps.title: Stay Calm
steps.content: Take a deep breath. Babies can sense your stress, which may make feeding more difficult.

steps.title: Check Basic Needs
steps.content: Is baby's diaper clean? Are they too hot or cold? Sometimes addressing comfort helps.

steps.title: Try Skin-to-Skin
steps.content: Undress baby to their diaper and place them on your bare chest. This can trigger feeding instincts.

steps.title: Change Positions
steps.content: If one position isn't working, try another. Some babies prefer different positions at different times.
